revision.comment: Correct as of match played 24/2/19, vs Elche
revision.text:
{{Spanish name|Martínez|López}} {{BLP sources|date=May 2016}} {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2016}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Toni Martínez | image = Toni Martinez 2015 SBS Cup (cropped).jpg | image_size = | caption = Martínez at the 2015 SBS Cup | fullname = Antonio Martínez López{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=18 February 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1997|6|30|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Barrio del Progreso]], Spain | height = 1.80 m{{Cite web | title=Antonio Martínez| publisher=Premier League| accessdate=17 January 2018| url = https://www.premierleague.com/players/19681/Antonio-Martínez/overview}} | position = [[Forward (association football)#Striker|Forward]] | currentclub = [[CD Lugo|Lugo]]
(on loan from [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]]) | clubnumber = 9 | youthyears1 = 2013 | youthclubs1 = [[Real Murcia]] | youthyears2 = 2013–2016 | youthclubs2 = [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] | years1 = 2013–2016 | clubs1 = [[Valencia CF Mestalla|Valencia B]] | caps1 = 16 | goals1 = 2 | years2 = 2016– | clubs2 = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] | caps2 = 0 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2017 | clubs3 = → [[Oxford United F.C.|Oxford United]] (loan) | caps3 = 15 | goals3 = 1 | years4 = 2018 | clubs4 = → [[Real Valladolid|Valladolid]] (loan) | caps4 = 10 | goals4 = 1 | years5 = 2018–2019 | clubs5 = → [[CF Rayo Majadahonda|Rayo Majadahonda]] (loan) | caps5 = 13 | goals5 = 2 | years6 = 2019– | clubs6 = → [[CD Lugo|Lugo]] (loan) | caps6 = 4 | goals6 = 1 | nationalyears1 =2014 | nationalteam1 = [[Spain national under-17 football team|Spain U17]] | nationalcaps1 = 4 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 =2015 | nationalteam2 = [[Spain national under-18 football team|Spain U18]] | nationalcaps2 = 2 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 =2016 | nationalteam3 = [[Spain national under-19 football team|Spain U19]] | nationalcaps3 = 2 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | club-update = 16 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = }} '''Antonio Martínez López''' ({{IPA-es|anˈtonjo maɾˈtineθ ˈlopeθ}}; born 30 June 1997), known as '''Toni Martínez''' {{IPA-es|ˈtoni-|}}; , is a Spanish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)#Striker|forward]] for [[CD Lugo]], on loan from [[Premier League]] club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]]. He has represented Spain at [[Spain national under-17 football team|under-17]] and [[Spain national under-19 football team|under-19]] level. Prior to joining West Ham, Martínez played for [[Real Murcia]] and [[Valencia CF]] at youth level, and [[Valencia CF Mestalla|the latter's B-team]] at semi-professional level. ==Club career== ===Valencia Mestalla=== Born in [[Barrio del Progreso]], [[Region of Murcia|Murcia]],{{cite web|url=http://www.whufc.com/Teams/Development-Squad/Squad/Antonio-Martinez |title=Antonio Martinez|publisher=West Ham United F.C. |accessdate=14 February 2019}} Martínez began his footballing career with local side C.F.S. El Progreso and later joined [[Real Murcia]].{{Cite web |title=El 'doctorado' de Toni Martínez en Oxford |trans-title= |first=Alberto |last=Rubio |work=Marca |date=18 February 2017 |accessdate=14 February 2019 |url= https://www.marca.com/futbol/premier-league/2017/02/18/58a78499e2704e75518b45c7.html |language=es}} In 2013, he signed for [[Valencia CF|Valencia]]. Initially a member of the club's academy ''Cadete A'' team (for players aged 14–15 years), Martínez was soon admitted to their reserve side, [[Valencia CF Mestalla|Valencia Mestalla]] (Valencia B). He made his senior debut in the ''[[2013–14 Segunda División B#Group 3|Segunda División B]]'' (third tier) at the age of 16, coming on as a [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] and scoring in a match against [[AE Prat]] on 8 December 2013.{{cite web | url=http://www.diariodemestalla.com/s/escuela/a/838-el-ano-de-toni-martinez- | title=El año de Toni Martínez | publisher=Diario de Mestalla {{es icon}} | date=14 June 2014 | accessdate=24 April 2016}} In three seasons at Valencia Mestalla he played 16 games and scored two goals, and made a further eight appearances, a goal and three assists for the club's [[Valencia CF (youth)|under-19 squad]] in the [[2015–16 UEFA Youth League|UEFA Youth League]].{{cite web | url=http://www.uefa.com/uefayouthleague/season=2016/clubs/player=250068973/index.html | title=Antonio Martínez | publisher=UEFA | date=1 April 2016 | accessdate=12 May 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170821144714/https://www.uefa.com/uefayouthleague/season=2016/clubs/player=250068973/index.html |archivedate=21 August 2017 |deadurl=no}} ===West Ham United=== In April 2016, Martínez agreed a three-year deal to join English club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] on 1 July 2016 for a fee of around £2.4 million.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36113462 |title=Toni Martinez: West Ham sign teenage Valencia striker |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 April 2016 |accessdate=24 April 2016}} He was given permission to train with his new teammates by Valencia to help him settle in England and would initially link up with West Ham United's [[West Ham United F.C. Under-23s#Development squad|development squad]]. Martínez was given the number 29 shirt for the [[2016–17 Premier League|2016–17 season]].{{cite web |url=http://www.whufc.com/News/Articles/2016/August/3-August/2016-17-squad-numbers-confirmed |title=2016/17 squad numbers confirmed |publisher=West Ham United F.C. |date=3 August 2016 |accessdate=6 August 2016}} He marked his [[Professional Development League|Premier League 2]] debut with a goal against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]], in a 3–0 home win. After scoring seven goals in as many games for [[West Ham United F.C. Under-23s and Academy|West Ham United U23]] during the first half of the season, he suffered two injury set-backs; the first left him sidelined for six weeks with the player due to return to action on 21 November, but then suffered another injury. His prolific goal-scoring feats continued into January and before long he had racked up a total of 12 goals from 11 games.{{Cite news|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/west-ham-youngster-toni-martinez-is-in-frightening-form-with-12-goals-in-11-appearances-for-under23s-a3425006.html|title=12 goals in 11 appearances: West Ham's Martinez in 'frightening form'|last=Long|first=Sam|date=20 December 2016|work=London Evening Standard|access-date=9 April 2017|dead-url=}} ====Oxford United (loan)==== On 23 January 2017, he was sent out on loan for the first time in his career, to [[EFL League One|League One]] side [[Oxford United F.C.|Oxford United]] until the end of the 2016–17 season.{{cite news|url=http://www.oufc.co.uk/news/article/2016-17/oxford-united-west-ham-martinez-3534302.aspx |title=Oxford Sign West Ham Striker Martinez |publisher=Oxford United F.C. |date=23 January 2017 |accessdate=23 January 2017}} The player was handed the number 7 shirt by the club. On 28 January, Martínez came on as a substitute to score his first goal for the League One side in a 3–0 home win over [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] in the fourth round of the [[FA Cup]].{{cite news |url=http://www.thefa.com/competitions/thefacup/match-stats?season=2016&competition=1&match=901756 |title=Oxford United 3 – 0 Newcastle United |publisher=The Football Association |date=28 January 2017 |accessdate=28 January 2017}} He made his League One debut in an away fixture against local rivals [[Swindon Town F.C.|Swindon Town]], a game which Oxford won 2–1,{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38786523 |title=Swindon Town 1–2 Oxford United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 February 2017 |accessdate=5 February 2017}} and scored his first league goal, a late consolation goal in a 3–2 home defeat at the hands of league leaders [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]], on 7 March.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39111485 |title=Oxford Utd 2–3 Sheffield Utd |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 March 2017 |accessdate=8 March 2017}} ====Return to West Ham==== On 7 January 2018, Martínez made his full West Ham debut in an [[2017–18 FA Cup|FA Cup]] third round tie at [[Shrewsbury Town F.C.|Shrewsbury Town]], replacing [[Javier Hernández]] after 71 minutes in a 0–0 draw.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42526171 |title=Shrewsbury Town 0–0 West Ham |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 January 2018 |accessdate=8 January 2018}} ====Real Valladolid (loan)==== On 1 February 2018, it was announced that Martínez had made a deadline day loan switch to Spanish club [[Real Valladolid]] for the remainder of the [[2017–18 in Spanish football|2017–18]] season.{{Cite web | title = Toni Martínez apuntala la vanguardia | trans-title = Toni Martínez bolsters the forward lines | publisher = Real Valladolid | date = 1 February 2018 | accessdate = 1 February 2018 | url = http://www.realvalladolid.es/noticias/actualidad/01022018/Toni-Martinez-apuntala-la-vanguardia/ | language = es}} He contributed with one goal in ten appearances, as his side achieved promotion to [[La Liga]] in [[2018 Segunda División play-offs|the play-offs]]. ====Rayo Majadahonda (loan)==== On 13 August 2018, Martínez joined [[CF Rayo Majadahonda]] still in the [[Segunda División]], on loan for [[2018–19 Segunda División|the season]].{{cite web|url=https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2018/august/13-august/martinez-signs-loan-rayo-majadahonda|title=Martinez signs loan at Rayo Majadahonda |publisher=West Ham United F.C.|date=13 August 2018|access-date=13 August 2018}} He made his debut for Majadahonda on the opening weekend of the season, on 19 August against [[Real Zaragoza]], Majadahonda's first game at this level. He was introduced as a second-half substitute, replacing French midfielder [[Enzo Fernández|Enzo]]. He marked his debut, and secured his place in Majadahonda's history books, with the club's first goal in the Segunda División. The match finished in a 2–1 defeat.{{Cite web |title=Real Zaragoza vs. Rayo Majadahonda - 19 August 2018 |work=Soccerway |accessdate=14 February 2019 |url= https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2018/08/19/spain/segunda-division/real-zaragoza/rayo-majadahonda/2861551/}} ====Lugo (loan)==== On 18 January 2019, Martínez rescinded his loan deal with Majadahonda and moved to fellow second division team [[CD Lugo]], on loan until June.{{cite web|url=https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2019/january/18-january/martinez-links-la-liga-2-outfit-lugo-loan|title=Martinez links up with La Liga 2 outfit Lugo on loan|publisher=West Ham United F.C.|date=18 January 2019|accessdate=14 February 2019}} On his debut eight days later, he scored the opener in a 3–2 home win against his former club.{{cite web|url=https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2019/january/28-january/loan-round-martinez-scores-lugo-debut|title=Loan round-up: Martinez scores on Lugo debut|publisher=West Ham United F.C.|date=26 January 2019|accessdate=14 February 2019}} ==International career== Martínez played four matches for [[Spain national under-17 football team|Spain U17]], making his debut on 22 January 2014 against [[Italy national under-17 football team|Italy]].{{citation needed|date=January 2017}} In 2015, he received a call from [[Spain national under-19 football team|Spain U19]] to participate in the [[2015 UEFA European Under-19 Championship|2015 UEFA Under-19 Championship]] in [[Greece]].{{citation needed|date=January 2017}} ==Career statistics== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" {{updated|match played 24 February 2019}} |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="3"|League !colspan="2"|National Cup !colspan="2"|[[Football League Cup|League Cup]] !colspan="2"|Other season|2016–17]]{{soccerbase season|82026|2017|accessdate=11 October 2017}} |rowspan=2|[[Premier League]] |0||0||0||0||0||0||colspan="2"|—||0||0 |- |[[2017–18 West Ham United F.C. season|2017–18]] |0||0||3||0||0||0||colspan="2"|—||3||0 |- !colspan="2"|Club total !0!!0!!3!!0!!0!!0!!0!!0!!3!!0 |- |rowspan=2|[[West Ham United F.C. Under-23s and Academy|West Ham United U-23s]] |2016–17 |colspan=7|—||1Appearances in the [[EFL Trophy]]||2||1||2 |- |2017–18 |colspan=7|—||3Appearances in the [[EFL Trophy]]||2||3||2 |- |[[Oxford United F.C.|Oxford United]] (loan) |[[2016–17 Oxford United F.C. season|2016–17]]{{soccerway|antonio-martinez-lopez/324453|T. Martínez |2017|accessdate= 12 February 2017}} |[[EFL League One|League One]] |15||1||2||2||0||0||0||0||17||3 |- |[[Real Valladolid]] (loan) |[[2017–18 Real Valladolid season|2017–18]] |rowspan=3|[[Segunda División]] |10||1||0||0||colspan="2"|—||1Appearances in the [[La Liga play-offs]]||0||11||1 |- |[[Rayo Majadahonda]] (loan) |2018–19 |16||2||2||0||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||18||2 |- |[[CD Lugo]] (loan) |2018–19 |5||1||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||5||1 |- !colspan="3"|Career total !62!!7!!7!!2!!0!!0!!5!!4!!74!!14 |} {{notelist}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[https://www.premierleague.com/players/19681/Antonio-Martínez/overview Antonio Martínez profile] at Premier League.com *{{BDFutbol|302285}} *{{Soccerway|antonio-martinez-lopez/324453}} *{{Twitter|AntonioMtnez_29}} {{CD Lugo squad}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Martinez, Toni}} [[Category:1997 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Sportspeople from Murcia]] [[Category:Murcian footballers]] [[Category:Spanish footballers]] [[Category:Association football forwards]] [[Category:Segunda División players]] [[Category:Segunda División B players]] [[Category:Real Murcia players]] [[Category:Valencia CF Mestalla footballers]] [[Category:Real Valladolid players]] [[Category:CF Rayo Majadahonda players]] [[Category:CD Lugo players]] [[Category:English Football League players]] [[Category:West Ham United F.C. players]] [[Category:Oxford United F.C. players]] [[Category:Spain youth international footballers]] [[Category:Spanish expatriate footballers]] [[Category:Expatriate footballers in England]] [[Category:Spanish expatriate sportspeople in England]]
